description: Parks Canada requires a contractor to remove and dispose of the existing washed-out culvert structures, supply, and install new culvert on Highway 58, and Hay Camp Road KM 41 in the Wood Buffalo National Park.
full_summary:
**Hay Camp Culvert Replacement - Stage 2**
-------------------------------------------------

### Tender Information

* **Tender Reference:** CB-6755-41952542
* **Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0086/A
* **Publication Date:** June 27, 2023
* **Closing Date/Time:** July 12, 2023, 4:00:00 PM (MDT)

### Project Overview

The Parks Canada Agency invites qualified suppliers to bid on a Stage 2 (financial) proposal for the Hay Camp Culvert Replacement project in Wood Buffalo National Park. The expected start date for this project is July 18, 2023, and completion is anticipated before September 30, 2023.

### Project Requirements

The successful bidder will be required to:

* Remove and dispose of existing washed-out culvert structures on Highway 58 and Hay Camp Road, KM 41
* Supply and install new culvert
* Haul gravel
* Prepare the site
* Remove and dispose of the existing culvert
* Purchase and install a new culvert
* Meet the specifications outlined in the Alberta Specifications for Highway Construction

### Acquisition Method

This is a competitive bidding process, where qualified suppliers have been invited to submit financial proposals based on the specifications and drawings provided. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.

### Evaluation Criteria

Bidders will be evaluated based on their financial proposals. The award of the contract will be made to the lowest bidder that meets the requirements outlined in the specification.

### Contract Terms and Conditions

The contract will be governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and will be subject to the standard terms and conditions of the Parks Canada Agency.

### Contact Information

For any questions or further information, please contact:
Ken Lacanilao
Contracting and Procurement Agent
Parks Canada Agency
(587) 832-1894
kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca
